A więc, ponieważ $P(y|\theta_j)$ prawdopodobieństwem uzyskania danych $y_{ij}$ z grupy $j$ pod warunkiem średniej rozkładu *a priori* dla tej grupy $\theta_j$.

A więc:

$$P(y|\theta_j) = \prod_{i=1}^{n} \exp\left( -\frac{(y_{ij}-\theta_j)^2}{\sigma^2}\,\right) = \exp\left( -\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n}(y_{ij}-\theta_j)^2}{2\sigma^2}\,\right)$$

Zauważmy też, że: 

$$P(y|\theta_j) = \exp\left( -\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n}(y_{ij}-\theta_j)^2}{2\sigma^2}\,\right) = \exp\left( -\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n}y{_j}^2-2\theta_j\sum_{i=1}^{n}y_ij + \theta_j^2}{2\sigma^2}\,\right)$$

$$\begin{equation}
\begin{aligned}
P(y|\theta_j) ={} & \exp\left( -\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n}(y_{ij}-\theta_j)^2}{2\sigma^2}\,\right) \\
    ={}  & \exp\left( -\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n}y_{ij}^2-2n_{j}\theta_j\sum_{i=1}^{n}y_{ij} + n_j\theta_j^2}{2\sigma^2}\,\right) \\
    ={}  & \exp\left( -\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n}y_{ij}^2-2n_{j}\theta_j\sum_{i=1}^{n}y_{ij} + n_j\theta_j^2}{2\sigma^2} \frac{\frac{1}{n_j}}{\frac{1}{n_j}}\,\right) \\
    \propto{}  & \exp\left( -\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{y_{ij}^2}{n_j}-2\theta_j\sum_{i=1}^{n}y_{ij} + \theta_j^2}{2\frac{\sigma^2}{n_j}}\,\right);  \\
    \propto{} & \exp\left( -\frac{(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{y_{ij}}{n_j}-\theta_j)^2}{\frac{\sigma^2}{n_j}}\,\right) \\
    \propto{} & \exp\left( -\frac{(\bar{x}_j-\theta_j)^2}{\frac{\sigma^2}{n_j}}\,\right); \hspace{2em}\bar{x}_j = \sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac{y_{ij}}{n_j} \\
    
\end{aligned}
\end{equation}$$

Czyli widzimy, że możemy zaprezentować naszą funkcję wiarygodności jako $$P(y|\theta_j)$$, jako prawdopodbieństwa orzymania średniej w grupie $\bar{x}_j$ pod warunkiem $\theta_j$. 




$$\begin{align}
-\frac{1}{2}\left[\frac{(\bar{x}_i - \theta_i)^2}{\epsilon_i^2} + \frac{(\theta_i-\mu)^2}{\tau^2}\right]  &= -\frac{1}{2}\left[\frac{\bar{x}_i^2 - 2\bar{x}_i\theta_i + \theta_i^2}{\epsilon_i^2} + \frac{\theta_i^2 - 2\theta_i\mu + \mu^2}{\tau^2}\right] \\
&= -\frac{1}{2}\left[\frac{\theta_i^2}{\epsilon_i^2} - \frac{2\bar{x}_i\theta_i}{\epsilon_i^2} + \frac{\bar{x}_i^2}{\epsilon_i^2} + \frac{\theta_i^2}{\tau^2} - \frac{2\theta_i\mu}{\tau^2} + \frac{\mu^2}{\tau^2}\right] \\
&= -\frac{1}{2}\left[\left(\frac{1}{\epsilon_i^2} + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\right)\theta_i^2 - \frac{2\bar{x}_i}{\epsilon_i^2}\theta_i + \frac{\bar{x}_i^2}{\epsilon_i^2} - \frac{2\mu}{\tau^2}\theta_i + \frac{\mu^2}{\tau^2}\right] \\
\end{align}$$


$$\begin{align}
-\frac{1}{2}\left[\left(\frac{1}{\epsilon_i^2} + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\right)\theta_i^2 - \frac{2\bar{x}_i}{\epsilon_i^2}\theta_i + \frac{\bar{x}_i^2}{\epsilon_i^2} - \frac{2\mu}{\tau^2}\theta_i + \frac{\mu^2}{\tau^2}\right] &= -\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{\epsilon_i^2} \\ + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\right)\left[\left(\theta_i - \frac{\tau^2 \bar{x}_i + \epsilon_i^2\mu}{\tau^2 + \epsilon_i^2}\right)^2 - \frac{\tau^4\bar{x}_i^2 + 2\tau^2\epsilon_i^2\bar{x}_i\mu + \epsilon_i^4\mu^2}{(\tau^2 + \epsilon_i^2)\epsilon_i^2}\right] \\
&= -\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{\tau^2} + \frac{1}{\epsilon_i^2}\right)\left[\theta_i - \frac{\tau^2 \bar{x}_i + \epsilon_i^2\mu}{\tau^2 + \epsilon_i^2}\right]^2 + \frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{\tau^2\bar{x}_i^2 + \epsilon_i^2\mu^2}{\epsilon_i^2\tau^2 + \tau^4}\right)
\end{align}$$

Now we can see that the expression is proportional to the exponential of this quadratic form:

$$\begin{equation}
-\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{1}{\tau^2} + \frac{1}{\epsilon_i^2}\right)\left[\theta_i - \frac{\tau^2 \bar{x}_i + \epsilon_i^2\mu}{\tau^2 + \epsilon_i^2}\right]^2
\end{equation}$$
$$\begin{align*}
&\exp\left(-\frac{\sum y_i^2 - 2\sum y_i\theta + \theta^2}{2\sigma^2} - \frac{\theta^2 - 2\theta\mu + \mu^2}{2\tau^2}\right) \\
&= \exp\left(-\frac{1}{2\sigma^2}\sum y_i^2 + \frac{1}{\sigma^2}\sum y_i\theta - \frac{1}{2\sigma^2}\theta^2 - \frac{1}{2\tau^2}\theta^2 + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\theta\mu - \frac{1}{2\tau^2}\mu^2\right) \\
&= \exp\left(-\frac{1}{2}\left[\frac{1}{\sigma^2}\sum y_i^2 - \frac{2}{\sigma^2}\sum y_i\theta + \frac{1}{\sigma^2}\theta^2 + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\theta^2 - \frac{2}{\tau^2}\theta\mu + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\mu^2\right]\right) \\
&= \exp\left(-\frac{1}{2}\left[\left(\frac{1}{\sigma^2} + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\right)\theta^2 - 2\left(\frac{\sum y_i}{\sigma^2}\right)\theta + \frac{1}{\sigma^2}\sum y_i^2 - \frac{2\mu}{\tau^2}\theta + \frac{1}{\tau^2}\mu^2\right]\right)
\end{align*}$$




$$\begin{equation*}
\exp\left(-\frac{\sum y_i^2 - 2\sum y_i\theta + \theta^2}{2\sigma^2} - \frac{\theta^2 - 2\theta\mu + \mu^2}{2\tau^2}\right)
\end{equation*}$$
